properties.Title: Update: Flood Warning Continues For The Red River From Emerson To The Red River Floodway Channel Inlet
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre continues to issue a Flood Warning on the Red River from Emerson to the Red River Floodway channel inlet due to high water flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions given by local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2019-05-04T10:45:00-05:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2019-05-03T10:53:02-05:00, 361F6358-0492-FC2E-5457-C05F7F176D1C
Area: Red River from Emerson to the Red River Floodway channel inlet
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Cancelled: The Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Issued For Town Of Davidson Has Been Cancelled.
properties.Summary:
Description: Cancelled the precautionary drinking water advisory for the Town of Davidson. The test results came back clear, and the water is now safe to drink again.
Expires: 2019-05-07T13:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Davidson, 2019-05-02T15:09:30-06:00, 6E523D14-5FB9-9C39-2087-F468B16C4B4F
Area: Town of Davidson
properties.Author: SK Davidson

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Heavy snow is currently falling between Southend and Collins Bay. Up to 30 cm has already fallen in the Southend area. Both Collins Bay and portions of the Southend region can expect an additional 10 to 15 cm of snow today with event totals of 35 to 45 cm expected by the time the snow ends Saturday. The heaviest snow will begin to ease overnight before tapering off Saturday morning. Early this afternoon heavy snow and strengthening easterly winds will cause reduced visibility in blowing snow. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-05-04T09:26:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-03T17:27:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2417439988.2019
Area: Wollaston Lake - Collins Bay, Southend - Brabant Lake - Kinoosao
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An area of low pressure over eastern Alaska will combine with a ridge of high pressure over the Mackenzie river valley to give strong winds near the Richardson Mountains. East winds of 90 gusting to 110 km/h will occur today and then ease somewhat to 70 gusting to 90 this evening. Winds will ease to light Saturday morning. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-05-04T02:59:32-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-03T17:18:32-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2029584243.2019
Area: Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. A band of heavy snow has set up over northwestern Alberta. Portions of the warned regions have already experienced 5 to 10 cm of snow. A further 5 to 10 cm can be expected through the day with more snow to come overnight in to Saturday. For the Whitecourt and Edson regions, the heavy accumulating snow should be confined to the northwest portion of the region including Fox Creek. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-05-04T06:46:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-03T14:47:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2682384402.2019
